evidence: PPV equals True Positives over (True Positives plus False Positives).
NPV equals True Negatives over (True Negatives plus False Negatives).
sensitivity and specificity tell us how the test performs in an abstract sense, relative to ground truth.
Suppose we are using CT to detect a tumor.
If the imaging study says a patient is abnormal, how likely is it that they really have the disease?
If the imaging study says a patient is normal, how likely is it that they really are disease-free?
PPV tells us how likely it is that this really is a tumor and not just a false alarm.
If the scan comes back clear, NPV tells us how confident we can be that the patient truly has no tumor.
positive predictive value (ppv): fraction of patients whose medical imaging calls abnormal actually have disease
negative predictive value (npv): fraction of patients whose medical imaging calls Normal and do NOT have disease.
ppv equals true positives over (true positives plus false positives).
npv equals true negatives over (true negatives plus false negatives).
PPV equals True Positives over (True Positives plus False Positives).
NPV equals True Negatives over (True Negatives plus False Negatives).

triples.evidence: PPV equals True Positives over (True Positives plus False Positives). So, among all the patients labeled as abnormal, PPV is the fraction who actually do have the disease.
triples.o: True Positives over (True Positives plus False Positives)
